paragraphs.text:
%md
## Streaming and DataFrames
This is the second notebook of the **Streaming Meetup RSVPs** set of notebooks.  The purpose of this notebook is to connect to the [Meetup Streaming API](http://www.meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/stream/2/rsvps/) and execute a streaming notebook.

*Meetup Sources*
* Based off of the [Meetup RSVP Ticker](http://meetup.github.io/stream/rsvpTicker/)
* Reference: [Meetup Streaming API > RSVPs](http://www.meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/stream/2/rsvps/)

result.msg:
Streaming and DataFrames

This is the second notebook of the Streaming Meetup RSVPs set of notebooks. The purpose of this notebook is to connect to the Meetup Streaming API and execute a streaming notebook.

Meetup Sources

  • Based off of the Meetup RSVP Ticker
  • Reference: Meetup Streaming API > RSVPs

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Attributions
Various references utilized through this example
* [Spark Streaming Programming Guide](https://people.apache.org/~pwendell/spark-nightly/spark-1.6-docs/latest/streaming-programming-guide.html)
* [Streaming Word Count](https://demo.cloud.databricks.com/#notebook/146957) and [Twitter Hashtag Count](https://demo.cloud.databricks.com/#notebook/147068) notebooks
* Spark Examples [NetworkWordCount.scala](https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/examples/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/examples/streaming/NetworkWordCount.scala)
* [Meetup-Stream MeetupReceiver](https://github.com/actions/meetup-stream/blob/master/src/main/scala/receiver/MeetupReceiver.scala)
* [Killrweather KafkaStreamingJson.scala](https://github.com/killrweather/killrweather/blob/master/killrweather-examples/src/main/scala/com/datastax/killrweather/KafkaStreamingJson.scala)

### Imports
Various packages required for this streaming example. 

* The Spark Streaming imports
* The AsyncHTTP Client to connect to the Meetup API

paragraphs.text:
%spark
// Spark Streaming
import org.apache.spark._
import org.apache.spark.storage._
import org.apache.spark.streaming._

// AsyncHTTP Client
import com.ning.http.client._
import com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig

result.msg:
import org.apache.spark._

import org.apache.spark.storage._

import org.apache.spark.streaming._

import com.ning.http.client._

import com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig

paragraphs.text: %spark

%md
### Configurations
* Configurations for this streaming application
%spark

%md
### Setup: Define the function that sets up the StreamingContext
* Create persistent table `meetup_stream` to store meetup data
* Create MeetupReciever 
 * Source: [MeetupReceiver.scala](https://github.com/actions/meetup-stream/blob/master/src/main/scala/receiver/MeetupReceiver.scala)
 * Install the Async-HTTP-Client Library 
   * [Async-HTTP-Client Library Source](http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.ning/async-http-client/1.9.31)
   * Follow the Install Library Notebook for steps to install external Scala / Java JARs
* Define the function that creates and sets up the streaming computation (this is the main logic)

result.msg:
Setup: Define the function that sets up the StreamingContext

  • Create persistent table meetup_stream to store meetup data
  • Create MeetupReciever
  • Source: MeetupReceiver.scala
  • Install the Async-HTTP-Client Library
  • Async-HTTP-Client Library Source
  • Follow the Install Library Notebook for steps to install external Scala / Java JARs
  • Define the function that creates and sets up the streaming computation (this is the main logic)

paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- meetup_stream
--   This table will persist the meetup data

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS meetup_stream

%sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS meetup_stream (
  group_country STRING,
  group_state STRING,
  group_name STRING,
  event_name STRING,
  member_id BIGINT,
  response STRING
)
%spark

%md
### Start Streaming Job
* Stop existing StreamingContext if any and start/restart the new one
* Here we are going to use the configurations at the top of the notebook to decide whether to:
 * stop any existing StreamingContext, and start a new one, 
 * or recover one from existing checkpoints.

paragraphs.text: %spark

%md
### Interactive Querying
* Now let's try querying the table
* You can run this command again and again, you will find the meetup information changing.

result.msg:
Interactive Querying

  • Now let's try querying the table
  • You can run this command again and again, you will find the meetup information changing.

paragraphs.text:
%sql
insert into meetup_stream select * from meetup_stream_json

result.msg:
Table or view not found: meetup_stream_json; line 1 pos 40
set zeppelin.spark.sql.stacktrace = true to see full stacktrace

paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Query temporary table (updated every `batchIntervalSeconds`)
select * from meetup_stream_json limit 20

paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Query count from persistent table
select count(1) from meetup_stream

%sql

-- Query persistent table 
select * from meetup_stream limit 10

result.msg: group_country	group_state	group_name	event_name	member_id	response

paragraphs.text: %spark

%md
### Review Reports and Spark UI
As this streaming application is running, check the following:
* View the **Reports and Dashboards** to watch the reports change on refresh
* Spark UI for the cluster: note the increasing in scheduling delays due to inserting data into the `meetup_stream` table

result.msg:
Review Reports and Spark UI

As this streaming application is running, check the following:

  • View the Reports and Dashboards to watch the reports change on refresh
  • Spark UI for the cluster: note the increasing in scheduling delays due to inserting data into the meetup_stream table

paragraphs.text: %spark

%md
### Stop Streaming Job
* To stop the StreamingContext, uncomment below and execute

result.msg:
Stop Streaming Job

  • To stop the StreamingContext, uncomment below and execute

paragraphs.text:
%spark
StreamingContext.getActive.foreach { _.stop(stopSparkContext = false) }
%spark
%spark
